result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A Castro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expunction will be allowed upon completion of payment of fine.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A Castro

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: $263.25 Failure to pay, civil judgment

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Ward.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court imposes $50 fine plus costs, deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge, bond applied, 30 DTP remainder due or civil judgment; credit for one day served.  Expunction will be allowed upon completion of payment of fine.
for substitution of attorneys; Atty J Ward for Atty B McFadden.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Ward.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Ward is taking over case from Atty McFadden.  Court approves stipulation for substitution of attorneys.  FPT continued to 8/3/16 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
With Atty McFadden the FPT of 6/1/16 at 2pm is rescheduled, due to a trial proceeding in Br 6 on this date; reset to 6/22/16 at 8:45am.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney B McFadden.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty McFadden's suppression motion.  Witnesses are sequestered.  Testimony taken from:  KSD Deputy Kimberly Gall.  State rests.  Testimony taken from:  KSD Deputy Tyrone Johnson.  Defense rests.  Court denies motion to suppression for reasons set forth on the record.  FPT set for 6/1/16 at 2pm.  Bond continued.
With ADA Phan and by agreement of Atty McFadden the MH of 3/31/16 at 3pm is rescheduled, as the State's witness is unavailable; reset to 5/12/16 at 3pm.
to suppress evidence and statements; filed by Atty B McFadden.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney B McFadden.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty McFadden files suppression motion.  MH 3/31/16 at 3pm.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
from Michelle/Atty Ward.
With Michelle/Atty McFadden the FPT of 1/27/16 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as Atty McFadden still needs to obtain discovery; reset to 2/18/16 at 8:45am.
Atty:  Bryant J McFadden.
from the Public Defender's Office, defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
D.A. re-scheduling PTC from 1/8/16 to 1/22/16 at deft's request
$300 deposited on 11/6/15

961.41(3g)(e) - Poss of THC

249pm
  Special Prosecutor Attorney Daniel Tombasco  appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Defendant requests Jury Trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.  $300  Continued Posted Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).    jk
